revised_title: Crystal and Molecular Structure of Quaterrylene: A Study of Bond Lengths and Aromatic Hydrocarbons
tldr: The authors studied the crystal and molecular structure of quaterrylene, an aromatic compound, and found that its pen-bonds linking the naphthalenic units are longer than normal C-C bonds in aromatic hydrocarbons. This discovery is significant in understanding the influence of hybridization-type on the effective covalent radius of the carbon atom. The crystal structure of quaterrylene is determined by two-dimensional methods, and the authors discuss the possible reasons for the difference in bond lengths compared to current theory predictions.
